benchmark_details.name: 3D-RAD (3D Radiology Med-VQA Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: 3D-RAD is a large-scale dataset designed to advance 3D Medical Visual Question Answering (Med-VQA) using radiology CT scans, comprising six diverse VQA tasks which support both open- and closed-ended questions, along with complex reasoning challenges.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance 3D Med-VQA research by providing a benchmark that supports multi-temporal and multi-task evaluation in the context of real-world clinical reasoning.

data.source: Curated from CT-RATE, a large-scale 3D chest CT dataset paired with radiology reports
data.annotation: Generated using a semi-automated pipeline with strong large language models (LLMs) and extensive human validation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance on defined tasks using standard evaluation procedures.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in answering the clinical questions accurately.
methodology.validation: Validation through LLM scoring and human evaluations to ensure high-quality QA pairs.
